body_html:
Hi @Hoeze, if you wish to operate over fixed-length batches of elements, I would suggest using group_by_window (see here for an example) over group_by_reducer, but I otherwise agree with @mrry's advice.

I will keep this issue open and close it when I added the coalesced reduce() operation.
body_text:
Hi @Hoeze, if you wish to operate over fixed-length batches of elements, I would suggest using group_by_window (see here for an example) over group_by_reducer, but I otherwise agree with @mrry's advice.
I will keep this issue open and close it when I added the coalesced reduce() operation.
body:
Hi @Hoeze, if you wish to operate over fixed-length batches of elements, I would suggest using `group_by_window` (see [here](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/contrib/data/python/kernel_tests/bucketing_test.py#L201) for an example) over `group_by_reducer`, but I otherwise agree with @mrry's advice.

I will keep this issue open and close it when I added the coalesced `reduce()` operation.
